alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 30 at 3:34AM MST until December 31 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West and northwest winds 25 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Burnt and weakened trees in recent burn scars will be especially susceptible to falling over. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are forecast over the high peaks and east slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains from sunrise until mid morning.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
